I don't believe you could really even make a fun game BHVR, but if you ever did don't even think about me playing it. All you want is to make Feng cosmetics. I don't plan on being the one buy them from you. You know you were the best thing for me in quaratine so why did you have to screw it up? Was it because you didn't want to be tied down? Was it because you just want to screw over everyone possible without actually fixing the game? Soon, you'll realize that cosmetics aren't anything without gameplay. I don't believe you had the nerve to tell me that you lost the Stranger Things license. How could you lose it when you've been fucking around with Capcom and Hellraiser. That's disgusting! You're sick, hiring people like almo: knowing that he was messing up with buffing Freddy and ruining Pig main's lives is what made me see exactly what type of studio you are and what you did to me. I'll never play DBD again. You've ruined it for me. I don't think could ever trust you. I can't play something I can't trust. I don't want you to ruin my life again. I'm afraid of you. It's sad. I thought I really knew you but I guess I was totally wrong. 

But that new Jeff cosmetic looks okay. 8/10

I don't have 500,000 hours or anything like some of these people do. I have a love hate relationship with this game. The game is great as a package. Play killer to hunt survivors and play survivor to repair gens and escape killer. The killers in this game are so cool and each one having a unique ability gives this game a lot of replay value. Playing survivor can be very rewarding as escaping the killer is quite difficult at times. A lot of maps and map variations to see in the game. Perks and items and add on's can change your play style drastically or even give you new abilities. It all seems great at first until you start to hit the higher ranks. The way the game is made unfortunately puts some killers and some perks on the sidelines. They become useless because players know how to counter them effectively but also because these powers and perks were not all designed with end game in mind. The balancing of this game is abhorrent. Survivors being able to loop endlessly with certain perks makes this game a nightmare to play sometimes. Now survivors have the ability top drop a pallet and when the animation starts they are given invincibility making looping even more annoying. Lag is apparent in this game constantly being a source of irritation. My biggest issue with this game though is it is repetitive and not in a good way. It's the same game over and over. Not like playing a singleplayer game over and over where you have different goals and enemies to deal with in different ways but just the exact same multiplayer match every time. Kick gen, down survivor, hook survivor. Repair gen, save friend from hook, loop killer. It always boils down to the same thing. The reason why I am giving this a positive review is because the love the devs and the hardcore fans have for this game. It's awesome seeing all of these icons in the present back for blood. Seeing Mikey in a game and being able to play him is amazing. Stuff like that makes me feel like this game may not be for me but it is still a pretty good and exciting game.
Playing this game is like being in a abusive relationship.  I keep telling myself that I deserve to be happy but keep crawling back to it.
Great game for toxic groups of friends. Have fun trolling the killer.

I changed my mind this game sucks.

I've decided I'll keep track of my fun experiences here.

1. 3 gens left and the killer gets his 4k on us. He proceeds to complain about how two of our team mates were running prove thyself. He continues to whine and trash talk us. I explain to him kindly that he got the 4k and that he was using very suppressive perks so there's really no reason to complain. It didn't matter apparently the two prove thyselfs were the end of the world for him.
would get tunneled again

i'm not sure how fun this game can be as a casual but it has really cool things like iconic movie characters and its really cool to see them in the game and play as them/against them. when you get to the high ranks and start learning the game and stuff you'll find out how the community is, being a killer main but playing survivor as well the survivors can't really do anything wrong but can only be toxic, killers can be told they are camping when they might not have much options so playing killer you will be judged a lot in high ranks, high rank killers will lose to survive with friends because it is OP.

Survivor;
Do generators, cleanse totems, unlock chests, save your team mates because they get hooked often and escape the killer..

Killer; 
Chase survivors, knock em down, hook them, damage generators and repeat..

Best played with friends, you'll usually be teamed with bad players, get a nice killer who farms? gg. 
Killer gives you a huge adrenaline rush and is by far scarier to play but survivor 100% has so much more to do.

Also, people stop hiding and do some generators.
